ChangeNote: Decomposition will occasionally fail due to excessive memory use. This is now corrected.
Only use one common InputFieldDefinitionManagerVolatile . Change wait time to 5 seconds.
Correct CDS price sign when it is component of a fund and when there are multiple holdings in that fund
Update Zlib1.dll.
Authorisation check on Extraction Definition window takes a lot of time. Try to reduce this by running it on unique set of tables

GL transactions export- in case no portfolio and portfolio group are shown for unauthorised user, no any portfolio condition was applied to find finance transactios. In this way the user was able to compress the finance transactions that he is not supposed to see. This has been fixed

Correct ImsBranch in Transactions RVP settings
Correction of the program error that occurs during the running portfolio calculation while simulating payment date booking.
added a new config pram to enable the tab.

Fix Oracle hints  overwrite in DEXs to empty values when merging DWH target with IMW
Fix issue where input fields with similar names return multiple results instead of the exact match

When executing general reconciliation, wrong comments, classifications, etc. could be assigned (copied) to new external records, if there were only external results in the execution. This was corrected.  Now all identification fields from all the reconciliation lines are used to identify if new unmatched external records should get a comment copied or not. Previously, only ID fields from rules for which internal records existed were considered.
Correct Order manager amend allocation flow for deal allocation transactions

In the 'Trade Repository Pool' 'Nominal balance after trade' was wrongly determined as 0, in case 'Opening Sequence number' was not defined a 'Accounting split field' in the relevant FAP. This has been fixed.
Fixing issue where released orders did not generate broker restrictions in a timely fashion.
Fix of missing custom attributes (PortfolioGroup)  in the Cash Viewer for BA/CB
The system performance of compliance validations with rating rules has been improved.

The composition of the inflation curve when "Include CPI values" = true has been corrected such that the lag defined on the RPI on the contract is correctly taken into account when "Decompose XpressInstruments" is used.
Fix web API tests. Changes made to the code do not affect system behavior.
Fixed an error that can lead to a very high memory consumption on the pre-trade and post-trade compliance services.
Formula mapping were incorrect after merge of standard facts/dimensions if some new standard fields were added. Was fixed
fix for maturity date full field in IMW transactions fact
Resolve issue on PCL inconsistency in the adjustment default date field caused by a transaction with system-owned reversal is later deleted.
Make the captions of the transaction codes for the old and new functionality for the CDS Option instrument type more distinct.
If a user was trying to connect to Bloomberg using DAPI in the Asset Manager to get real time prices/fx rates and there was an authentication issue this was not shown to the user
When calculating a 'Volatility Curve' Definition having 'SABR Shift' checked in very rare cases a database error could occur. This has been fixed.
Refined our internal test process to ensure expected behavior. The message now appears only as an informational/warning notice rather than an error, with no impact on business operations

Special ex/cum functionality can be disabled from a specific end-date in Transaction Options.
When disabled, but Dividends was created before the end-date, the dividend payment date was used instead of the ex date for calculating the nominal basis.
This was not correct as before it was disabled it was the ex date that was used for calculating the nominal basis.

The problem has been solved by using the ex date also when the functionality is disabled, but dividends are generated before the end-date.
When importing the Risk and Performance Analytics Configuration from version 25.07 and earlier to a higher version, a crash occurs due to the new Axioma Stress Test tab. This issue has been fixed.
Support fixings cap/floor for FRNs with different coupon and compounding calendars
List history: Improve system performance related to viewing list history when list has been through 4-eyes approval.
Remove Limit Configuration and Results: Change the way tables are emptied
Flaky test ignored
Target Name in DWH Load Monitor has index defined in Load Plan for jobs executed in parallel.
Fixes various crashes on DWH Model import
After this change the missing FX rates will be reported correctly.
When approving multiple alerts at the same time, threshold approval is not possible.
Fixed failing unit tests in the SimCorp.IMS.AltInv.DocProcessing.IntegrationTest namespace.
Capture trade not working for classic orders. Fixed

Pre-trade performance optimization: System performance problems in the order-result association logic has been optimized. The problem was especially noticeable in in result of relative rules with MANY positions (>10.000) and MANY numerators (>1.000).

Enable the satellites for RTMAIN to detect contention situations by examining the lag in received ALIVE messages  and correct a flaw in the serialization logic of the RTRefinitiv price flushing flow which led to performance degradation.
Fixed an error related to client restriction rules in Compliance. This error can lead to a crash when the client restriction definition for a portfolio is empty.
Add missing fields to the Allocation message when initiating Amend allocation from the Quick Amend window

The "Multi Manual Finance Transaction" form now has an extra validation preventing saving, when the decimals on the amounts does not correspond to the digits on the corresponding currency.

The 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job produces fund decomposition data for the Investment Analytics Platform. The solution was flawed in the scenario where a component moves out of the fund, e.g. in case of a sell transaction. In this case, the market value SOD and cash flow SOD values that corresponds to the "moves out" would appear on the residual instead of on the component itself.

The problem has been solved by enhancing the 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job, so it produces a data record for the component on the day it moves out. The record has SOD and EOD weights equal to zero to dictate that the component moves out. With this additional data record, the market value SOD and cash flow SOD values appear on the component itself, thus resulting in a better decomposition.

Please note that existing data in the Investment Analytics Platform will not be impacted by this correction. A new 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' is needed for this correction to impact the results in the Investment Analytics Platform.
Fixed the crash on creating a LoadPlan for a DWH Model having semicolon-separated list of values for the ExpireDeletedRecords Configuration Parameter
Added -autrole and -pmg to list of acceptable command line arguments

Amounts for benchmark groups are calculated incorrectly. In case if a security is in several benchmarks and (accordingly) benchmark holding groups, it's total amount was populated to all the groups without distributing it in accordance with the actual amount weights. This has been fixed.
Add more explicit searching transactions condition
Flaky test ignored
Add project version to npm audit report title
Extra validation added to series symbol and full symbol for future rolling. Now we also check the characters are uppercase and that the full symbol ends with a digit.
MSCI, ExchTraded model: fetched Settlement price for the Bond/Euity Forward in case when it is a fund component. And replace pCLEAN with pCLEANUND

The portfolio calculation did not include a bank account position having a zero balance on the first calculation date, but a non-zero balance on the last calculation date. The problem was that a cost/tax payment in the bank account had a cost payment date prior to its transaction agreement date; while the last portfolio calculation date was later than the cost payment date, but prior to the transaction agreement date. The zero-position check in the portfolio calculation did not find such payments. The error has been corrected for both bank accounts and cash buckets.
Making Calculate average execution time event compatible with schedule.
Fix error message in "Front office model - Execute" batch job
Disabled performance tests. Changes made to the code do not affect system behavior.
A program error occurred when loading a record using a deleted reference date. This has been corrected.
DWH: Fixed database field overflow when serializing flow events
A program error occurred when using  'Start Batch Job Group' in the 'Batch Monitor'. this has been corrected.

It is client specific code to introduce a check to ensure that when the MDV event is seen to be ready, it truly does not have any un-validated unfinished MDV events linked to the fund. When there are un-validated unfinished MDV events, then STP process allows rules that fail but have an error level of warning to skip the check and allow the validation to continue. An extra information is logged for further investigation.
Flaky test ignored
Increase a regex timeout for analyzing complex rules and fragments while validation
Authentication credentials replaced to ensure ASB test is correctly executed.
Performance optimization when handling many aux jobs.
Add additional condition for finding linked parcels - if system found the original parcel - finish the search and move to other parcel
Update of internal SimCorp tool, which does not affect any customer installations
Added optional  floatOffset tag to the GenericBondModel, overnightIndexedCoupons section

The log message “Saving information about Execution into RDATAPOOLEXECS.” was incorrectly flagged as an error when saving a Reporting Pool. This issue was fixed in D-90424 (version 26.01). To meet client requirements, the fix will be backported to 25.10, ensuring the message remains informational with no functional impact.

A program error occurred when executing the Validate Market Data. This defect has now been fixed. Moreover the functionality is now compatible using Workflow schedules.

An error could occur in the 'Portfolio Calculation' in case 'Adjustment frequency' was not set to ''No adj.' and in case at least one 'Hedge' position with Hedge adjustment' 'Freeze' and 'Hedge risk free price adjustment method' 'Dollar offset - Retrospective (constant spread and curve)' was supposed to be calculated. This has been fixed.
Fixed redemption payment date for callable bonds if call/put option is applied and option date falls on a holiday.

Structured ABSs incorrectly used future Pool Factors in valuation. 

And in general bond options did not take effects analysis date into account for the underlying bond.
An error could occur when one GCA framework was installed in the SCD installation and all GCA values were 0 on the transaction. This has bene fixed.

The database load generated by the message queue service when looking for messages to process has been reduced.
Removed vulnerable packages from apigw

The query used to find cash bucket positions/movements when using Period Closure has been optimized.
Technical: 
- An existing index on table TRANSSUBLRPDATES has been changed (extra column added). 
Updating this index during upgrade may take some time.
- Hint has been added to force Oracle to use the correct index on table TRANSSUBLEDGER
Add a delay when between attempts to reconnect to the Message Broker

As part of "handling holdings, etc." in the calculations we need to "decompose" the securities into underlying securities. There were some system performance problems in that, that cause d long startup times for compliance services at some customers.
Reduce the database load (table SECBUSCLASSTS) when loading Parties.
Reduce the database load generated by the Collateral dashboard service by optimizing SQL statements.

Reduce the database resources used when saving Data Warehouse information during the save of Performance Reports results (Oracle table PERFREPDELNODEINFO). The change will only affect customers having Data Warehouse installed.

To improve the performance of the validation when saving US pool static data, a new index has been created on IBI.POOLNO.
When saving fund figures Oracle could in some cases chose a nonoptimal execution, leading to bad performance. A database hint has been added to ensure Oracle uses the relevant index.

When technical transactions are generated for cash bucket and bank accounts on nominal framework, the subsequent P/L framework is impacted and generating technical transaction on the same day for  P/L framework gets incorrect figures for balance fields (QC/PC). This change fixes this issue.

During calculation Front Office Data for Nominal Agreement Framework, we did not check that Nominal number blocked for Buy and Sell complies DB constraints. As a result, in very rare cases it caused crash on FOD services. Fixed.
The composition of the inflation curve when "Include CPI values" = true has been corrected such that the lag defined on the RPI on the contract is correctly taken into account.
This is an internal SimCorp change. No customers are affected
Update Route for single place form to allow placing SPOs to Single brokers
Session might crash with due to WS FULL by getting initial conditions to calculate issue yield time series
In some situations, Oracle chose a wrong execution plan leading to a very bad performance for the ‘Initialising – Building keys...’ step. This has been corrected.
Do not recalculate FRA/IRF price if it is given as input.
Fix to handle issue in Broker restriction service where it took a long time to validate broker restrictions for a released order when list update import job was running.
A workspace full could occur when loading data. This has been corrected. Now the system will load the first x records, and warn more is present.
Elementary transaction components with message status ‘Rescheduled’ or ‘Error’ can safely be set 'On Hold' and should not be categorized as invalid.

When executing Data Warehouse Load Plans containing Star Marts, with the classic version of Qlik Sense configured: a Connection to Qlik Sense is now reused across Load Plan Executions. This is because Qlik Sense cannot close the connections promptly on the server after they are closed from the client. So this change is needed to avoid running out of available sessions, in case many Load Plans with Star Marts are executed back to back.

In form Custodies Access code field was hidden after sunsetting the Oasys and removing its commands from the INS files. Since the field needed for CTM it was decided to change condition for displaying it in case CTM is installed. Also, caption of the field was changed from "Access code (Oasys)" to "Access code".
We have added a fix using hpaAdd when adding residuals in creation of synthetic payments. This ensures higher precision and removes floating point issue
Fixed issue with pricing of CTD futures with underlying bonds by reverting some faulty changes.
Remove customer specific filling "Portfolio Name" towards Order Manager
Improve query execution time
This is an improvement to internal multi process utility with no impact on business functionality.
Proper handling of updating transactions without modification.

It wasn't possible to import SWIFT data for PARTNERS, if the installation was configured to only use one Portfolio Master, and at the same time the 'Allow SWIFT addresses to depend on portfolios' (Show Installation Parameters) was enabled. This has been corrected.

Fix for incorrect handling of .Net formula errors in compliance calculations.  It is valid for .Net client formulas to return null as a result. These errors would show up as purple dot system exceptions . Now they show up as blue dot data exceptions.

The 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job could fail with an error if a component in a decomposition has a SOD or EOD weight close to zero (smaller than 1E-7). Such an error would stop the batch job and prevent the files from being written. There are, however, valid situations where a component can have a weight close to zero or even exactly zero. E.g. if a fund has a large total value and a small component value that result in a weight smaller than 1E-7. This could happen with a total fund value of 10.000.001 and a component value of 1. Another example is an internal fund that invests in a future and create daily variation margin payments on the future. The error message is therefore misplaced and it has been removed.
When positions are in different currencies - aggregation level is now calculated for field Yield for Math.Adj Sold
Crash can happen during upgrade if authorisation profile of type ALL has access to any of tasks and commands  windows

Fix crash in Performance calculation with NAV Performance, PCL framework and no dividends matching dates condition.

General reconciliation could crash when tracking previous breaks is checked in the setting, and there is a one-side match in the reconciliation. This was fixed

Opening the history of compliance lists could take very long time. This has been optimized.

The 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job saves a daily RETURN_RC file that contains the RC return of the decomposed constituents. The RC return incorporates the price return in quotation currency and the currency return from the QC/RC FX rate. The currency return was calculated as FX_QCRC(t) * FX_RCQC(t-1). This is OK if the QC/RC and RC/QC rates are consistent, which they will be if they only save rates on one of the crosses. But if they both save their own rates, it is very likely that they are not consistent and then this way of calculating the currency return will result in a wrong value, since the return of the QC/RC rate should only involve QC/RC rates. The principle has been changed so the currency return is calculated as FX_QCRC(t) / FX_QCRC(t-1).

The sign is reversed of the open payables and receivables fields categorized according to transaction types in the portfolio calculation. Hence, now receivables or cash-in will be positive amounts, while payables or cash-out will be negative amounts. 
The fields are calculated when  "Open payments" and "Open and made payment reconciliation" check marks are enabled in the portfolio calculation.
The change only concerns the following complete list of fields: "Open Payables Transactions QC", "Open Payables Transactions PC", "Open Payables Transactions FX P/L PC", "Open Payables Dividends QC", "Open Payables Dividends PC", "Open Payables Dividends FX P/L PC", "Open Payables Interest QC", "Open Payables Interest PC", "Open Payables Interest FX P/L PC", "Open Payables Total QC", "Open Payables Total PC", "Open Payables Total FX P/L PC", "Open Receivables Transactions QC", "Open Receivables Transactions PC", "Open Receivables Transactions FX P/L PC", "Open Receivables Dividends QC", "Open Receivables Dividends PC", "Open Receivables Dividends FX P/L PC", "Open Receivables Interest QC", "Open Receivables Interest PC", "Open Receivables Interest FX P/L PC", "Open Receivables Total QC", "Open Receivables Total PC" and "Open Receivables Total FX P/L PC" available the List Calculation window of the portfolio calculation.

When an AM cache historical job is created and processed, in a portfolio master enforced environment, no data is saved for the job due to authorizations. The authorization should be skipped for AM cache jobs in this case and the authorization will be applied when user gets data for that historical job.

In the Application service the code concerning the file repository  has become more robust so that the server do not crash if the account running the service is unable to access or modify the accessibility of the relevant folders. If the service are unable to access or modify the accessibility the functionality regarding upload and download from the service becomes disabled

The 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' batch job creates a file with SOD and EOD weights for the decomposed constituents. The weights are based on dirty value of the constituents. By error the SOD weight on day t was based on dirty value from day t, where it should have been based on dirty value from day t-1.
No functional change - add logging to hedge ratio calculation in Asset Manager
Customer specific change for a customer specific issue.

An error could occur when trying to save transaction in the 'Create Corporate Action Transactions' window that were created with the 'Position adjustment (Derivatives)' check box being set. This has been fixed.

Deleting an alert for a specific criteria, for example Flow Step or Communication Parameter Set , only the details are deleted but rows with administrative information like 'assigned to' remained in the group. 
This has been changed. If only administrative rows been left in the Alert the entire Alert is deleted.

The market value and cash flow fields became wrong when both "Exclude fee segment" and "Use portfolio specific security codes" were checked in Performance Measurement and when at least one condition in the Fee Segment used a field which can be configured in "Portfolio Specific Security Properties"

The error has been corrected.

Affected Performance Measurements and Performance Reports must be recalculated.

This is a customer specific change which will not affect other customers.
Changing the STP status only when modification is expected

When working with Multiple payment screen the settlement defaults with other bank accounts are shown. Has been fixed.

This was earlier working for other screens where bank account is an instrument, but not for Multiple payments.
Add tags 9610. 9611, 9612 and 9613 to the Quickfix dictionary used in NOMA.
Ensure tables referencing tBUSCTR is not missing  index used be referential constraint.

UDKR contributions/distributions could be calculated incorrectly in the AM Cache if the setup specified that weights should be calculated per mandate/portfolio and the set of requested fields did not contain any regular contribution and distribution fields.  Only an issue if the none of the rows in the data selection has 'Treat as one mandate" checked

Added a CBU program, to ensure that portfolio life-cycle dates obey the validation restrictions in the Business Entities screen.

This is relevant due to a conversion program included in the upgrade to versions 26.01 and later, which creates new business entities based on the portfolios.
Fixing historical VaR aggregating issue.
Fixes a potential crash that could happen in the Calculation service when called through the STP service.

gMSA account used to start service agents, and thereby starting services, must have a UPN assigned. This UPN will be used as the identity for the endpoints of the service. The endpoints will use FQDN instead of IP address. These changes will enable use of Kerberos for client and service authentication.
Parametric VaR was not calculated due to not existing setting "Disable FX Option adjustments" in Asset  Manager and Compliance Manager. Crash has been fixed, and now Parametric VaR is calculated
Search for Apl core during DEX in BPAAS infrastructure.
To fix an error with incorrect General Approval status in CAM when there is one of the holdings with blocking. Relevant for UBS only
In case of reversals Reconciliation result is updated with new payment reference. Now a reference to active transaction is updated as well.
Fixing problem with CustomAttributes Values for PortfolioGroup were not populated when there is no initial balance in the CashViewer Applet.
Compliance pre-trade validation returns many system exceptions (with message "Index was outside the bounds of the array") that caused by the errors in the compliance pre-trade service log
portalIdAvailable did not return the right results

Prepare FO Modelling and Model Portfolio-Portfolio Transaction Generation could use old Model Portfolio Components after they were released from Asset Manager and MPC comments are used. Latest components are always used after this change. Prepare FO Modelling and Model Portfolio-Portfolio Transaction Generation is performed after MPC comments are saved.
Only active messages that take into account  the 'Official CA Event Reference', are considered as the basis for MT565 creation
After doing 'Truncate business data' some database constraints could be missing (disabled). This has been corrected.
It has been corrected to not crash on zero or close to zero discount factors.
The performance when calculating 'Key Ratio mapping Formulas' was very slow. This has been fixed.
Fixed pricing of swaps with payment lag in yield curve estimation using  Bootstrap method.

The system performance in the Compliance Manager was improved by avoiding unnecessary database queries in the Rule Entry and Lists window. Opening rules with lists should now be faster.

There was a performance issue with business classes loading in Asset Manager. This has been fixed now.
improve performance of webclient using cache of icons

The batch job "OTC Instruments - Validate All" will process transactions, which have some data in at least 1 of 5 grids: Payment Business Centre, Valuation Business Centre, Fixing Business Centre, FX fixing Business Centre, FX Convention Fixing Business Centre

Summation of weight fields were not calculated when doing subtotals via the Asset Manager Cache Api when the setting "Distribution figures per portfolio/mandate" were on and the group contained multiple portfolios.  Weight fields are fields like distribution- and contributionfields (including the UDKR-variants). The queries used to load decomposition data have been optimized.
Update of autotest. This will not affect any customers.

The value in the Date column of the Fixings sub-screen would not always be updated correctly when making changes to the Holiday calendar used.

A new batch task named 'Generic Decomposition - Upload Results' is now available in the Batch Job window. The new batch task prepares data files with decomposition data that enables decomposition of funds in the Investment Analytics Platform. The data is based on the 'Generic Decomposition - Calculate' batch job.

A crash happened when saving the order after selecting a predefined comment via F4 in the 'Multiple Portfolio Orders' window. This has now been corrected.

Corrected FIX tag 57 for classic single program orders
CustomerApplyNote: Fix the value sent in tag 57 for Classic Program Single Orders

ChangeNote: New random method - random by risk factor for MC generation option were added. This new method is considered to be applied for scenarios where the MC scenarios have to be preserved for the same risk factor IKs with the same seed value and the same risk factor selection ID.
Corporate action dashboard service: add logging in case of retries due to deadlock
Fixed problem with missing benchmark data for rules assigned to model portfolio node s beneath funds

Fix for a compliance-related error regarding missing external values in rules assigned to model portfolios.
External value definitions with "Scope = Model Portfolio" were not included in compliance validations when the rule was assigned to a model portfolio.
Make database selects in Aggregation calculation Init phase faster.
Update dya_config to honor change on System.Security.Cryptoaphy.Pkcs to have correct reference.
A fix for the Create Future Transactions window so that special close out transactions use the number of fixing days from static data as the number of settlement days for the transaction
DWH: Optimize DML statements used for loading versioned tables in Snowflake
Position Calculation: Make WS requirements lower in residual loop
Om should ignore bids received for ETF from TS
The Business rules alert service now updates the timestamp for last processing time more frequently to avoid the Business rules alert service wrongly being shutdown by the Service Platform

After removing the configuration parameter 'Nominal framework methods enabled' in 'Show Installation Parameters' => ''Transactions' in 26.01, the CBU error was revealed when testing an upgrade to 26.01 as a preview drop. To avoid it, the usage of the configuration parameter is now disregarded in the lower versions. This will not affect the customers installation, since the functionality has been already enabled by default earlier.
Extend the scope of custids
The testOtcTMControllerFntAllocMsgBlock APL unit test relies on non-real securities. The identification of these securities has been changed.
Validation should be removed for allocate command.
Default payment transaction does not have impact on  franking credit  fields
Added Managed Identity connection type for AM cache services
Extend Override ID field length in Instrument exception settings from 20 characters to 100 characters

When saving either 'Data Format Setup' or 'Direct Filter/Data Format Setup Integration' with the 'Publish DFS as API' option selected on the 'Data Format Setup', the system will validate the ID to prevent duplicate API endpoints.

In rare cases it could happen that when distributing ccy adjustments to multiple payments, large values would appear in the "Ccy adjustment PC" column of the "Payment reconciliation" form. This was due to wrong rounding logic and has been resolved.
Internal codebase refactoring. Fixed the code to improve when we include stack traces in error messages. Changes made to the code do not affect system behaviour.
Do not create extraction definitions for standard base marts if subject areas of those are not installed.
Enhance error message about problem with reading file with error returned by operating system
Fixed an issue in handling of group code changes that could cause a freeze of the Asset Manager or Asset Manager Cache
change source for EFFECTIVE_DATE in BF_TRANSACTION to indicate TRANSMAIN.INTBEGDATE

Added a hint to the main query used by the Asset Manager Calculation service to read holding data.  In some situation it did not pick the correct execution plan which could lead to slow database queries
Adjustment of cmd parameter for net 8 services
Client specific change which prevents the STP flow to be interrupted by errors that client wants to ignore, when using Calculation Services.
fix flaky test
Suggested allocation date check was added in Allocation handler.
No functional changes. fixing tests
Aligned nr of arguments with DoJobExecute to fix length error

Stock loan fee transactions for CFD positions wrongly updated the holding field date latest coupon. This caused issues when trying to create a  proceed transaction at an earlier date than the stock loan fee transaction. The error has been corrected.

The Valuation date was not updated by the 'OTC-Validate all' batch job when an additional holiday day appears in the relevant holiday calendar, in case more than one Index swap TM  transaction exists per security. Transactions for update are now searched using the transaction number field (instead of the security ID) (Changed key field (Security ID -> Transaction Number) to process transactions)
Fix L3 tests with including interest into calculation.
Use actual execution date in STRATBM_WEIGHT files (V1 & V2) created by AxR Position Integration upload batch job.
Classic FX Forward should not show FixingDate value instead of ValueDate
Flaky test ignored
Improve tree list control styling
Holdings missing in results when assignment units with different PKR setting/FX rate price type are calculated together post-trade. This has been fixed.
Resolved a precision error in CapRed Transaction affecting the Balance cum Dividend nominal calculation.
Added CR 626037 to the C# mirror of the decomposition fetch functions such that holding key ik is now respected when it comes to filtering potentially redundant hybrids.
No visible changes for users. Fix flaky unit tests
Patch of enabling SWIFT MX for Securities Netting
Fix auto-filling price for volume-basis simulations
Fixes a crash on "Latest Version" in the Data Warehouse Manager, "Show Diff" and "Merge" on Dimension GL Account.
Fix for Custom Analytics fact to avoid key violation

The 'Transaction Option' 'Use exchange from static data (derivatives)' wrongly also was enabled for the 'Dealer CFD' window. Even though on CFD static dat it is not possible to define an 'Exchange'. This has bene fixed.
We fix the Cash Viewer displays Dirty Value (DV) during a Deal Allocation stage of the order lifecycle.
Changed loading strategy in Reporting Data Pool application to take more data distributions into acccount.
Improved detection of test errors.
No impact on customers, expanded testing coverage
In rare cases, the simultaneous update of group codes for the same securities both locally and on the group code service can lead to a deadlock. This has now been corrected.
Added support for path that contains () in mediator defined function.
Internal use: Switch references to old MS-test assemblies to a newer version
Removed or updated package dependencies in the LFT client package.
The TARF XpressInstruments gets distributed with the releases without file installation.
Fix side effect of S-148979 where it causes the Include Cash option to be greyed out
Use high precision arithmetic  when  calculating order amounts.
Fetch the Model Portfolios from SAAM along with the MPs from the positions
If aggregation was equal to None and using performance figures the Asset Manager could crash in some rare situations.
We increased risk factor name field length when writing to volatility and correlation files
Created a new batch task to stop all continuous AM cache jobs
Code and resource migration
Fix the error where the ExchTraded model was not applied to derivatives, even though ExchTraded is a valid primary model for them.

If the shutdown of the AM Cache service took longer that the 'grace period' (normally 5 minutes) a job currently being processed could be left as Executing.  Now it will have state Completed (even if no data has been produced).  Furthermore the Delete (job) api has been extended with an optional Force parameter that allows deletion of any job
Incorrect loop creation in Position Calculation in case more than 100.000 holdings
Changed category of WebService test from L1 to L3, to avoid flakyness in the merge gate. This is an internal change for integration tests. The change has no impact on customers.
Fixed authorization for "Mandate default - Portfolio group" field in Data Selector
SQLs executed from the Settlement Dashboard are using a lot of resources on the database. This has been optimized
Solve referenced child record crash in risk alert cleanup

For Total Return Swaps with quote factor different than 100, the rates were wrong for the sub-fixing of 
the non-TR leg on the period end date.
The code checking if a command is installed has been optimized.
Making reconnect more robust and not throwing as many error logs
Client specific correction that relates to calculation of statistical key ratios in Performance Measurement, Performance Manager and Performance Reports.

A code change has been made to improve stability and authentication when testing batch processing of market data validation queues in internal installations. This change will not impact any external clients.
Margin Manager => Margin Call Saga Viewer: Security ID was missing in the logging message when applying Margin Manager defaults for Call Money positions. Fixed.
Additional filtering was added for election's holdings
The performance of STP 'Matching' Payments' has been improved.
Update of internal SimCorp tool, which does not affect any customer installations
Customer specific change which should not change any SCD calculations
Error on refresh position in CM has been fixed
Add assertion for call money transactions that do not belong to corresponding collateral pool.
APL is on a single thread, so the static "caches" are reused on a second call. These caches must be cleared in case of data has been updated by user after the first batch job run.
Add hint to database query selecting related pre-trade results for alerts.
All authorization profiles that a user has been assigned to via different roles should be taken into account when evaluating if a user has access to a data selection.
Added possibility to show summary values for group rows

When 'Executing ' a 'Rebalancing' setup with 'Rebalancing type 'Currency overlay' and having 'Decompose funds' checked the error message 'You are trying to rebalance a setup containing unsupported instrument type(s)...' could wrongly also appear for decomposed positions. This has been fixed.
In Asset Manager (Options - Decomposition - Decomposition types) height of dropdown was increased to show all types at once.
Improved performance of Alerts Inbox in System Manager by optimizing processing logic of inner DB selects.

When result monitor applet shows a lot of results (several thousands) and a lot of results were changed in DB (> 5000) then Reconciliation manager froze for several minutes.  This was fixed and now refresh goes much faster

The 'Save effect details' check box in Performance Measurement controls if risk factor sensitivities and factor changes should be aggregated into the measurement tree and saved to the result tables. The user is asked if existing details data should be deleted when changing the check box selection. But nothing was deleted even if the user chooses to delete. This error has been corrected so the sensitivity and factor change data that is toggled by the check box is deleted if the user chooses to delete.
DWH: Fix user marts ignoring cutoff values when being loaded incrementally
Fix the issue, now the simulated transactions with non-zero price are not priced with Fixed Implied Spread pricing approach.
Improved performance of Alerts Inbox: updated how the system reads reconciliation runs so the database can find each run in one quick step, speeding up queries and reducing load times.

In the 'Portfolio Calculation' 'Simulated unrealised hedge depreciation QC/PC'  was not calculated in case a position was lend out and part of a hedge relationship at the same time. This has been fixed.
Technical changes related to the Compliance Partitioning. The value for CMPLRESTYPE field in the reporting helper table CMPLREPDETAILS has been corrected.

We have fixed an issue where the status in the General election status field was incorrectly updated, when a corporate action event was transferred to static data in the Corporate Actions Manager. This is done by removing zero balance holdings when the status in the General election status field is defined.
Add support for the <ValueDate> tag in the XML. Value from this tag to update 'Settlement date' on transaction
Collateral Cassini integration:  issue a message to user regarding not recommended AccrIntCalc settings on Pool.
Make sure Analysis date is UTC kind and make data last updated in UTC format
Fix incorrect Nominal calculation on CA open transaction in TM
Fixed  sticky session behavior when connectiontarget is "*" and downstream service agent was changed
Crash in Risk Measurement/Performance Calculation/Position calculation in case of decomposing hybrid funds. Was fixed
Fixed error in the Order Manager Management service following Daily maintenance
Support injecting SSS config files at container runtime.
Allow the ability to inject static data at runtime for the Bundled Environment in a configurable way.
The summary type for alphanumeric custom fields is now Unique
Make Workspace size requirement lower for position calculation decomposition
Tests modified to be not flaky
Raise status from Warning to Error for Extraction object is not validated message for Extraction Exporter Definition.
Fixed Nominal in Modify position window to respect current Percentage change on Incremental update
Added more info when an rare occurring error happens

If the test project references a newer MSTest but your runner (or another assembly) is binding to an older version, the method signature may not be found.
Use ReferenceEquals instead of AreSame method

In certain situations it was possible for a service to attempt a fallback to local APL execution after failing to find an APL worker service instance w/o actual being capable of executing locally. This would cause an error with a difficult to understand message. The error message has now been improved.
For convertible bonds priced with OneLib only tranform the Quoted price method to Theoretical when the discounting cuve was shocked in market data scenarios.
Correction of programm error found while decomposing. Related to IFRS9 purpose inheritance.
Fixed vulnerable version for vite npm package

Logic specific to a single client was removed in Performance Measurement. The logic hard coded the benchmark return to 0% on the first day for new dynamic split value nodes in the Performance Measurement tree.
In some cases reconciliation payments were generated with wrong portfolio currency. It has been fixed.

When a transaction is modified on a high status with a auxiliary job that has Now (outside commit sequence) then there is a timing issue that can trigger that the cancel job on the reversed transaction is triggered twice. This has been corrected.
Fixed case when a user with appropriate privileges was unable to retrieve data via the OrderDetails and LinkedOrders endpoints when using non-default portfolio masters.
Avoid crash in calculations for OneLib convertible bonds, when the key ratio OAS is not requested.
This is an internal change for integration tests. The change has no impact on customers.

When saving new issue of a Japanese government bond in Asset manager (Simulations/Portfolio sheet applet), the 1st coupon payment date is automatically calculated based on issue date and coupon term & unit.
Cassini integration: Added validation which prevents auto substitution  via MM   for multi-currency calls via CASSINI
Rounding for Interest in Securities Lending Maturity transaction window was corrected.
Disable flaky tests
An error could occur when allocating a block order for Trade Manager instruments that was copied from a previous trade. This issue has now been resolved

The system didn't detect the right dependencies for User Defined Key Ratios so that the subtotal calculation in the AM Cache Api did not calculate the right numbers if not all  QC/PC/RC fields were explicitly stated
Rounding rule field was fixed

When a SimCorp Dimension installation have too many open alerts (> 10.000) the Business rules alerts service could become unresponsive during processing of alert changes and therefore were shutdown by the service platform. The error has been fixed. In addition the service now logs a warning before every new change processing  in case the SimCorp Dimension installation has more than 10.000 open alerts.
Flaky test ignored
Flaky test ignored
Changed title of "Asset Manager Cache monitor" from using the "AM"-abbreviation to "Asset Manager"
Add Flexible Analytics IK to Benchmark Aggregation Calculation fact
Fix failed tests due to changed output format. Does not affect business logic.
Pre-trade results have grown in size because information irrelevant to the performed pre-trade check is included in the results. This has been fixed.
Load authorisation cache for pre-trade orders API only once
Ensure grid properties activated because they contain non-empty data stays active when switching to another layout.
Test moved to LR category to run weekly

This regards transactions from the window ‘Exercise FX Options’ and similar transactions  in the Trade Manager. The calculation of the settlement amount as a sum of amount components should not be altered in the classical window.
FX placement now can be auto-allocated when done for day flag is received
Added validation which prevents auto allocation via MM or batch job for multi-currency calls via CASSINI
Additional check if the TRS is Forward Starting is added while looking for the relevant position: Forward Started TRSs are not supported at the moment
Improve validation message for swap rate correlation standard contracts
Fixed an error that occurred when updating capital event static data for ADRs and Fund certificates with data from a new CA notification for an existing capital event.

In the 'Portfolio Calculation' wrongly an error message complaining about missing prices could appear, incase a position was lend out and part of a hedge relationship at the same time. This has been fixed.
When finding the settlement date for an XpressInstrument via Capture Trade in the Order Manager, the holiday calendar specified for the instrument was not taken correctly into account.
OM Automation service to use unmanaged oracle driver to be consistent with the rest of OM
In explain price search the Quoted + yield curve price method for mid-curve swaptions was incorrectly labelled as "Theoretical price, mid-curve swaptions"
Fix a possible issue in OM allocation block transaction creation for CDS index. Disable recalculation of notional when dictated by block.
Unit test related. Is not visible to a user of SCD
YieldForMathAdjSold should be calculated for average financial accounting method
Feature switch to use the new Front Office Data service is off by default. As a result, for new client Balancer does not work. Fixed. Now new Front Office Data service is used by default.
There was no authorisation for Portfolio Groups (only for Portfolios) in Trade Manager. This was fixed here.
Communication service, mediator: adding more resilience and logging to internalwebrequest CDL command.
Flaky test ignored
IMW updates: fix for Dims: Fra Security, Future Security, Performance Investment Structure. New dims/facts for Lineage. New fact PFC Cash Flow
The Rule entry - Credit Risk fields Collateral, issuer risk and Collateral, cpt. risk have now been re-enabled for holding base rules.
Fix program error during payment reconciliation of private debt for cases when there was not enough data to update subledgers.
A database error can occur for appendable portfolio calculation using the "Recalculate changed" setting. The error has been corrected.
Avoid 0 qty orders in blotter after merging programs
Apply price rounding correctly when allocating multiple Future placements from OM
CustomerApplyNote: Apply price rounding correctly when allocating multiple Future placements from OM

ChangeNote: Perform single heartbeat when NATS connection dropped and re-established
When scrolling over templates in AM Settings Template, Cash Viewer tab display is updating.

When calculating risk factor standard predictive and successive scenarios, the inflation curves risk factors were previously shocked in a way that was inconsistent with other yield-based risk factors. This inconsistency has now been corrected.
Skip redistribution of carried nominal for internal trade, so it will not be recalculated.
This change corrects some problems when importing into initially closed fields using only a single import sequence group.
Update OASYS CBU to handle auxiliary job definitions.
It was possible to create Reallocation Security No into security with incomplete static data. It has been fixed.
Change  0 values in generated file to empty, fix validations issues
Added function that copying Trading Platform field to the second leg
YieldForMathAdjSold to be present in MPV and TL
In the Asset Manager (Order Outbox applet), data is not displayed when the user changes the default role. The resolution is to consume the User Context in the Authorization Handler Provider class.
Conversion to dereference OASYS auxiliary job types and functionalities
The 'Economic Benefit' was calculated wrongly on 'Settle Loan Facilities' transactions. This has been fixed.
Ensure online static data updates are coming through for Workflow service
CompetingBids now contains quotation type IndexedPrice for received FIX bids with PriceType Price when instrument quotation type is IndexedPrice
Ensure that the minimum version of FNS is 25.10
Batch job "FIPA Effects Calculation - Upload Results" can only be seen if FIPA Effects Calculation module is installed.
Amend allocation of FX netted placements

Trade Manager/OTC API: Fix issue with incorrect field name in error messages related to empty security ID fields

Trade Manager Loan facility with GCA enabled: Payment amount GC is now updated when Cost/Tax is changed

Disabled the Corporate action specific transaction codes on the Bond swap for release as feature is not yet complete

Use a different counting mechanism

In the schema for OTC Search Web API the item pointer 'IML_instrument_type' is replaced with 'IML_OTC_instrument_type'. Now GET and DELETE endpoints in the OTC Web API work as expected for XpressInstruments with specified IML instrument sub-type
Unfunded value PC was not recalculated on Settle Loan Facilities when changing Amount in contract's in-subform. That has been fixed now.

In Asset manager (Simulations applet) in FX Single currency window security is now filled after base/price currency is filled. This ensures correct security selection according to FX simulations defaults.
Margin Manager -> Interest Statements tracker applet: Provide a Margin Manager user possibility to choose reason and comment on "Dispute Their Interest Statement" action.
Do not check mandatory fields from state controls when passing unsettled trades from Asset Manager to Front office Portfolio calculations copy.

For External and Internal message queues updated a mechanism that check if the data received from DB is correct and non-ambiguous. Add solution for cases when we retrieve only one data row with data info for requested transaction number.
Collateral Cassini integration:  issue a message to user regarding not recommended AccrIntCalc settings on Pool.
Reverted an earlier data import error formatting change.
Crash in Asset manager after deletion of FX Swap simulation. Fixed.
Use Pinned Connection
The CBU routine for moving past version 24.07 could report a false positive about 4-Eyes approvals needing changes even when no approvals existed. This has been fixed.
A save action failed after a final Manual Match in the General Reconciliation workflow due to a program crash. This defect has been fixed.
Respect the 'min_log_level' cnf.ini parameter in OTEL.
High availability of the FIX API service
Margin Management: Margin Calls with RecalReceive action and Parties Suggested Margin were not applicable for allocation via Simplex if a zero-balance Margin Account existed. Fixed.
N/A: Internal change: clients should not be affected, SmartQueue performance test improving.
GROUPCODEVALS dependency is added to the Compliance Rule configuration transport if Group Code attribute with textual value defines the rule.
In some situations the message queue service did not respect the creation order of messages within a discrete group. This has been corrected.

The error message 'It is not allowed to move cash between different portfolio masters' could wrongly appear when trying to load a transaction into the 'Overnight Account Payments' window. This has been fixed.

A correction is made to the factor based FIPA fair cash flow on decomposed spot legs of IRF positions in Performance Calculation. This affects the fair cash flow itself as well as the factor based FIPA local return, when this is calculated using the TWR based approach. The correction ensures that the cash flow adjustment is consistently based on exposure, which removes spikes in the factor based FIPA local return on decomposed IRF positions on days with buy or sell transactions.
[TECHNICAL/3T]  Re-enabled filter viewing. Item fields of item type 1, that are not drop-downs, should still have item sets.
An error could occur when processing 'Awaited Fund Events' on the STP service. This has been fixed.

This change is a performance enhancement related to the  Portfolio Calculation when you are using "Recalculation changed" in the Functions menu. The change reduces the number of holdings and transactions that are handled to those with virements on the holding. By reducing the number of holdings and transactions with a new condition, the calculation time is improved for the portfolio calculations.
Flaky test ignored
for OneLib Mid curve swaptions, when filling correlation data for interpolation, interpolate first in rows  and then in option maturities
Update of internal SimCorp tool, which does not affect any customer installations
Fixed a possible crash in order auxiliary job functionality. The crash could happen during the order update when the aux job fields include some security static data field.
Read ApiBaseURLPrefix dynamically from cnf.ini

When allocating order block allocations from the Order Manager using a CDS Index standard product, an error message saying "Standard Product ID is a mandatory field and must be specified if Security group is defined as False" could occur. The missing ID is now populated with a Standard Product ID.
Increasing api test coverage for delta vector
2T GUI update flow was called in 3T which cleared update flags!
Resolve leak in UP ConnectionPool and F.Data.Managed
Converting Order Manager FIX API service to NET8

After the CDS reversioning transaction, the new position could not be netted due to inconsistency in the security and original transaction number in the nominal match holdings. Here it has been fixed, the position netting transaction can be successfully saved.
Remove A_COLLATERAL_SUBRESULTS.MIN_RETURN_AMOUNT field from Standard Reports

When the same risk factor was mapped to multiple positions and imported sensitivities were used for pricing risk models (e.g., Monte Carlo, Historical), the imported sensitivities were taken incorrectly from Key Ratios Calculation =>Risk Factor Sensitivities. This issue has now been corrected.
Added dynamic reading of swagger.json version for downstream services
testBrick_UtilEndTransPreConditions removed from the brick test
Flaky test has been fixed and re-enabled again.
QC and PC key ratios were not not calculated for mid-curve swaptions using OneLib valuation. Resolved by setting pool factor to 1

Now, in the CTM screen, if a transaction that has only outgoing messages is selected, then the "Open Match" button in the form is enabled. If you press the button, the form "Match" will open and the tab "Deviations" will be activated. The figures of deviations will look like you get an empty (contains only zeros) confirmation message.
Change in internal tests, no impact on customer installations
Disabled the Corporate action specific transaction codes on the Bond swap for release as feature is not yet complete

For External and Internal message queues add a mechanism to check if the data received from DB (that is used to update Int and Ext message queues) represents the correct "Security" in scope of the requested "Transaction No".
Fix ORA-00001: unique constraint violation (SCDAT.P_DWHSYNCACTIONS) during Import of DATAWAREHOUSE entity
Update InputFieldDefinition fields when a new row is created

"Value filled PC absolute" and "Value filled QC absolute" was 100x the value as expected in OOB for Finished orders with special currency (like GBp/GBP). This was corrected together with Indicative price.
Reduce workspace requirement during initialisation phase of position calculation during decomposition
Fix a crash in OM allocation message processing for FX swaps

Rounding rules were not applied to the suggested margin amount for Margin Call with Return/Recall actions when the setting in Collateral Manager setup => Collateral Calculations => "Ignore MTA and rounding on full return/recall amount" is On. It was fixed.
A tab 'Investment Analytics Service - FIPA' has been made configurable.
Ensure that for MidCurve Swaptions the interpolated correlation cannot be outside the [-1,1] limits.
A problem with generic payment matching using manual payment reconciliation and external netting was found and fixed
UDKR weight fields were not excluded from calculation and streaming, fixed now.
Fix Asset Manager Cache API crash when we use GroupBy at web API request
Two Front office data service load balancers could handle the service queue in case of reconnection to another MUCS and two such services run.  This has now been corrected.
The lifetime for liquidating funds has been slightly adjusted so additional distributions are forecasted.
Added validation rule to Float Rate Index Definitions form. Now Customer Business Centre only allowed for TRSs
